results.title: Cooperage
results.creator_credit: Phillip Borsos, ONF | NFB and Rocky Mountain Films
results.brief_description: Features the Sweeney Cooperage, manufacturing wooden barrels in an assembly plant on False Creek in Vancouver, as it has done since it was founded in 1895 by Leo Sweeney. Points out that the cooperage is completely a family operation, and at one time it was the largest

results.title: Daybreak Express
results.brief_description: A short film that captures the mood of traversing New York City from day to night. Scored to a Duke Ellington track, entitled Daybreak Express, the film recalls a vibrant youthful city at the height of its mid-century pre-eminence. Pure Jazz

results.title: Running and mobility
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Bruce Moir, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Sound Studios and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into the specific exercises, training and conditioning techniques necessary for proficiency in running. Describes how the body adjusts to new levels of achievement with the proper training. (Photographer, David Foreman ; Script, Terry Jennings ; Editor, Andrew Prowse ; Sound, Rod Pascoe).

results.title: Cherith
results.creator_credit: Shirley Barrett, Francine Penrose and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Not being able to speak in tongues can be embarrassing at the very best of times. But if you are the only member of the congregation who cannot, and you are the daughter of a dynamic Revivalist preacher like Pastor Howard Spong - it’s even more distressing. And that’s just one of Cherith’s problems. This is a serious (and satirical) comedy about fundamentalist religion. This distinguished piece of film making , with a great script, direction and performance, won Best Short Fiction Film, AFI Awards in 1988.

results.title: Treating people as people
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Deals with integrated education for handicapped children and children with behaviour problems. Case studies are examined showing these children in ordinary schools as well as special schools.

results.title: Pigs!
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and behaviour of domestic pigs, using natural sounds and no narration. Records the faces, personalities, and varied textures of the pigs.

results.title: The Cavity caper
results.creator_credit: Newfilms and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatisation for children on the subject of dental care, in which Big Al and Louis try to outwit Kev Casual, but the Tooth Fairy comes to the rescue. The Army is also brought into the fight against plaque No other credits available. Cast includes Colin Friels. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Can't you bloody-well read?!
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Max Pepper, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A poignant study of adult illiteracy and its effect on the lives of one in ten adults in our community. The Department of Further Education is working on a new program that may provide an answer in the field of reading education. The aim of the film is to remove some of the shame illiterate people in the community feel, and to convince them they should do something about it.

results.title: Yorke Peninsula
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The sea in its various moods is the central “character” in this exploration of the scenery and recreational opportunities of Yorke Peninsula in South Australia. The agricultural and mining background of this region adds a further dimension to its natural pleasures.
